FuncDef:
The ip urpf peer-based command configures peer-based URPF on an interface.
The undo ip urpf command cancels peer-based URPF on an interface.
By default, peer-based URPF is not configured on an interface.
CLIs: ip urpf peer-based peer-id <peer-id> [ statistics enable ]
undo ip urpf [ peer-based peer-id <peer-id> [ statistics enable ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a peer group ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Indicates the statistics collecting function for peer-based URPF.
-

Enables the statistics collecting function for peer-based URPF.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Many attacks on the network are initiated by virtual source addresses. You can configure peer-based URPF on the interfaces connected to the network border to effectively prevent source IP address spoofing attacks.
After a peer group is bound to an interface and an IPv4/IPv6 data packet enters the device through the interface, the source IPv4/IPv6 address of the packet is matched against the routing table. If the source IPv4/IPv6 address matches a routing entry and the peer group ID in the routing entry is the same as that in the interface table, the packet passes the peer-based URPF check and is forwarded normally. Otherwise, the system considers the packet invalid and a source address spoofing attack occurs. In this case, the packet is discarded.
